description:
Black-Handed Henry, famed reaver captain of the pirate ship Darkest Day, has decided that in order to defeat the Heroes of Crystalia he needs potions of his own. Captain Henry has conscripted various monster alchemists and detained them in his ship. Captain Henry will grant freedom to the first alchemist who completes his potion. As for the others, the plank of the Darkest Day awaits…

Black-Handed Henry’s Potion Party, a dice matching game for 2-4 players, using the Super Dungeon dice. Players assume the role of a captured alchemist, trying to complete Captain Henry’s potion before the others. Of course, as bad guys, a little sabotage may be in order.

This stand-alone dice game comes complete with a full set of 16 Super Dungeon game dice, rules booklet, 8 unique Alchemist cards featuring new and exciting characters, and 8 unique potion recipe cards.

Description from the publisher:

Monopoly: Jurassic World delivers more dinosaurs, more attractions, and lots of buying and selling as you attempt to rule Jurassic World. Collectible tokens, Jurassic World money, and a custom Jurassic World dinosaur-inspired game board provide an exciting twist to classic Monopoly.

Sharp  your claws and fangs, avoid disasters , meteors and gather the strongest dinosaurs!

Dino Twist is a family game of cards , fast and smart, where players will have to fight the Dinos on the island of Twist, then recover them on their islands to score the most points. But beware to the events that will spice up the battles !!!

The goal of the game is to have the strongest Dino on our island.

How to play.
At the begin chose randomly 10 events on the 25, it will give a 10-15 mn game.
At the beginning of each turn, you reveal a event that apply for all players (except the first turn).
All players together, choose Dino from their hand, place it face down and reveal simultaneously.
If you play the same Dino (same species and same strength) you can't attack the Island of Twist and you discard your Dino in the cemetery.
The smaller Dino strike first, attack the Dino on the Island of Twist, and take it back to is own Island.
Each species can only attack their specie.
To attack a Dino, your Dino must be strongest (look at the number of strength)

At the end of the 10 events, the player with the most point on his island is the winner.

There is bonus, for the player who finish the Island first, second and third, and the player with the most Dino with big claws).

In the game, you have two different Island, one for children, initiation and one for adult more advanced game. In the advanced game you will have to respect the territories and species, whereas in the children game, you will be free to put any Dino of any species on your Island.

Think is a Trivia game with 5 knowledge areas.

On each player's turn, another player takes a new Card for reading the question(s).

On each Card there are 5 questions, for one each knowledge area. Which question is asked is determined by rolling 2 dice.
Rolling doubles or 6s results in a special effect, such as getting a free Point or getting 2 questions.

Different numbers (without 6) gives the active player the possibility to choose the knowledge area.

1 question/area on each card is bold. This is the master question where you bet 2 or 3 of your previous owned victory points, for doubling or loosing them.

In the small editions the actual Player gets the card for knowing the answer, in the big boxes there are additional "nuggets" (black stones) for counting the victory Points.

Game Ends when 1 player has a predetermined amount of victory Points.

Breakable is a game of futuristic ground and air combat for 2 to 4 players. Its set in the same future-history as Inteformic's earlier release Unbreakable.

You decide what forces and weapons you need to complete your mission. Employ fast but vulnerable skimmers to deliver a lightning blow to your opponent. Or choose sturdy tanks armed with heavier weapons. For defense, nothing beats the staying power of your bunkers. And don’t forget recons; shadow warriors who can infiltrate behind enemy lines to call in nuclear strikes from afar.

Then equip your units with nukes, lasers, autocannons, cluster bombs and more. Thanks to advanced materials technology your units are hard to kill, but still breakable.

Ostfront is H&S GAMES newest tactical infantry print-and-play project. June, 1941, as a German platoon leader you will fight your way across Russia in a tactical tour de force. Each month you will take part in engagements against a random number of Soviet squads and accumulate victory points which facilitate promotion, unit upgrades and awards.  Single, tournament style engagements or one of two campaigns may be played.  Designed from the ground up as a solitaire system, the game's brain is an innovative hex template that is used for unit placement.  This primary system works in concert with a proven chit pull sub-system and action charts which dictate if an enemy unit moves (if so what direction) fires, or does nothing. The map is framed by a slew of information which you must keep track of including: squad action points, leader action points, sudden death track, sniper track, month track, weather, initial German deployment, expected level of enemy resistance, engagement type (three possible types), arty/air strikes, and a victory point track.  The map is a generic, base map upon which terrain tiles are configured according to the given scenarios or simply your own whim! Combat is comprised of a combat results table that determines the number of step losses and subsequent pinned, suppressed or broken results.  Or, you may chuck the primary combat engine for an alternative "buckets" of dice combat engine!  Close combat is brutal and there are no guarantees in this game. Units will often have to roll to perform an action,and at game start, you will have to spot an enemy before you can fire at it. Finally, all of this occurs on a modest 7x9 hex grid!

There are 12 sheets with each 1 big image overfilled with people and things. There are 6 small parts of the big Image shown at the right side of the sheet. 
One of this sheets has to be choosen and put on the board.
The actual player has to find one of the 6 small image parts in the big image. 
The player touches both with the Ends of the 2 cables attached to the board. The electronic in the board will show if it's right or not.

The game uses an illustrated plan of a garden to form the basis for a number of games, some of which are described on the games board.  Using  a die players move their pieces around the map using the basic rules of not retracing their steps and following the direction of red arrows when landed on.  he designers suggest creating ones own games but some of the suggestions are below.

The Grand Tour: involves trying to visit all the main sights before anyone else and returning to the house.

Race: involves all starting from the Grotto and trying to reach the Orangery before anyone else

Afternoon Tea: 15 turns try and visit as many sights as possible each with their own point scores

Chase: Involves one player getting a head start and the others trying to catch them.

The board has a number of holes in it; in a turn, the player sets off his spinning top in the start area, with the intention of sending it forward towards the scoring holes. If it drops into a hole, points are scored.

First to reach a pre-agreed total of points, wins.
likely published ~1947-1950

A simple race game in the tradition of Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a red colored space, obey the instructions glued into the lid. Target space 75 must be reached with a matching number.

Tabletop, 1-6 player spy game set in 1941 Berlin that combines classic mystery elements like Clue, but with a defector.
 Setting. At the height of World War II, spies from around the world descended on Berlin, Germany to gain intelligence on military operations. Allied forces from countries including United States, England, and Russia engaged in dangerous clandestine operations, code breaking, and subterfuge. The secrets they obtained thwarted military advancements into Western and Eastern Europe. Now, you, the agent behind enemy lines in Berlin in the early 1940s, seek to decipher the enemy plans, avoid being caught by the Schutzstaffel, and uncover the double agent among your peers.

Gameplay. Operation Berlin is a mystery board game with a defector. The goal is to determine which military operation Nazi Germany is planning through process of elimination. Players move as spies through Berlin obtaining information and avoiding hindrances in the form of roadblocks, security guards, and Schutzstaffel. As an added challenge, players may be double agents trying to prevent the other agents from discovering the German plans. This game combines the mystery style of Clue with the player interaction of Resistance to create a unique and intriguing replaying of history.

Mystery Element: There are 9 possible missions characterized by the country of attack and type of attack. One of the missions is selected at random, unknown to the players, and placed aside as the actual secret mission. A tracking sheet assists players in eliminating possible missions when they find or trade information on what cards are not in the secret mission pile. First player to accurately guess the secret mission wins!

Defector: Based on the number of players there may be 1 or 2 double agents. By randomly drawing the agent and double agents cards at the beginning, no one knows what side the other players are on. This adds a covert element that will have players interacting, accusing, and defending until the truth is known. Double agents may choose at any point in the game to reveal their secret, allowing them to play as the German forces. If the double agent remains incognito, all players may accuse a person of being a double agent and force them to be uncovered. But if they guess wrong the game ends in a German victory!

Description from the publisher:

Me Want Cookies! is a cute family game for 2-5 players in which each monster tries to be the first to find the correct dessert and gain the most points.

In more detail, you are a nice monster with a big appetite for desserts. For each course of the meal, only one monster can eat a dessert and only the right dessert. Spot it before the others devour it!

1. Roll the die to set the first dessert.
2. Follow the licorice up to the dessert at the other end.
3. Grab the right dessert!

Marine Fighter Squadron is a game where you are a Commander of a hard charging, high flying, gung ho, Marine Fighter Squadron (or VMF) in the Solomon Islands in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your Squadron’s crew and aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces. Missions include Fighter Sweeps, Bomber Escort and Strikes on Japanese Air Bases and Naval Forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of Marine Fighter Squadron is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions).

Marine Fighter Squadron can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

Cork and Screw is a card game for 4-6 players. It has 288 cards total which includes Question, Answers and Challenge cards. It won't be for everyone. It is sexual, fun and ornery.

This game holds some similarities to games like Cards Against Humanity and Apples to Apples. The difference is in order to advance to the next level, the player must complete a challenge card and be judged by the other players.

Inferno is a standalone expansion to Arcadia Quest. It is 100% compatible with the original base game and introduces four new Guilds: Sharks, Tigers, Crows, and Serpents.  It features new types of heroes, such as Alchemists and Gladiators.

There is a new branching campaign system, and the storyline revolves around the guilds descending into a fiery abyss.  There are Brimstone cards that make the terrain risky to navigate, which operate similarly to the Tombstone cards from Arcadia Quest: Beyond the Grave.

A new mechanism called "Damnation" will tempt the heroes with powerful weapons that can corrupt the characters over time or change the behavior of nearby monsters.  There are also Angels, which are allied characters for the heroes to rescue, escort or assist.  Working with the Angels can affect the branching campaign path system and even allow the player to recruit them for use in later missions.

Co sÅ‚ychaÄ‡ na farmie? ("What's Happening on the Farm?") is a fast game in which you roll a six-sided dice, then try to find the animal that appears that many times on a card. Whoever makes the correct animal sound gets the card. After the deck runs out, whoever has the most cards wins.

Leva Livets Stora Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory is a big box edition of Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory. This box contains of 82 characters (instead of 36) and 75 bingo cards (instead of 25). The game can be played in three levels, eg. sundayschool year 1-3, with 25 characters for each level. The game plays the same way as Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory.

Hero Dice is a dice-based competitive role-playing game where every player is vying to become the most famous Hero around. Roll your character race, class and ability, and then set out exploring dungeons, fighting bandits, and showing up other Heroes.

At the start of you the game every player rolls to determine their Race, Class, and Ability. They will play a factor in battles against other players and enemies you encounter, providing advantages and disadvantages. As you roll other dice throughout the game, if you hit one of your 3 main die, it will automatically change to reflect the new die face up - only you can change your character.

During the game you'll be earning Fame and Infamy which can be spent to help you succeed at battles and gaining Companions. Though there's a lot of randomness to be had with dice, it involves a great deal of strategy and provides multiple ways to play and experience the game.

In a quest to become the most famous Hero around, how will you get there? Honor, deception, friendship, treachery...what kind of Hero will you become?

Description from the publisher:

Villainous rats have allied with vicious hunting birds to pillage the humble mouse settlement across Meanderfield. But look! Brave mice, mounted on starlings and blue jays, swoop in to wage war against this evil alliance! The Downwood Militia soars into action against the Vermin Raiders!

Plaid Hat Games proudly presents Tail Feathers, the exciting new miniature skirmish game by our very own Jerry Hawthorne set in the beloved world of Mice and Mystics. Soar across the table, send your troops on dangerous missions, lock beaks with opposing birds, and defend your nest!

Featuring the beautiful hand-sculpted miniatures by Chad Hoverter Mice and Mystics fans have come to love, Tail Feathers raises the stakes with 13 dutiful ground troops, 5 headstrong birds that tilt for launching and turning, plus 5 daring pilots. Players will recreate the famous battles for aerial supremacy that shaped the Mice and Mystics world.

Outwit and outfly your opponent in stand-alone scenarios, or play a full campaign and see your units gain skill from one battle to the next.

Tail Feathers is a stand-alone game, not a Mice and Mystics expansion, but you can use your Mice and Mystics: Sorrow and Remembrance miniatures in Tail Feathers right out of the box.

Tail Feathers offers cinematic gameplay and a fresh, whimsical setting for tabletop skirmish gaming. Players must balance the use of both flying and ground units to achieve victory. Here are some highlights:


     Compatibility! If you already own Mice and Mystics, you're in luck! Tail Feathers includes cards which allow you to use your Mice and Mystics figures in Tail Feathers! Bam!
     Story driven campaign! Tail Feathers includes a scenario book with story rich scenarios all designed to be played either as both stand-alone experiences or linked together as a campaign.
     Unique and challenging flight system! Tail Feathers includes 5 beautiful bird miniatures that are mounted on a special flight stand that allows the birds to 'tilt'. This tilting is a mechanism used to determine your flight direction, but the skill of effectively maneuvering your birds is up to you!
     Everything you need! No empty box here. Tail Feathers comes with enough content for two players to field fully-realized, battle-ready forces, as well as cards that allow you to utilize your Mice and Mystics: Sorrow and Remembrance figures as Tail Feathers ground troops right away. 


Tail Feathers expands the Mice and Mystics universe, introducing fans new and old to the battles on birds that secured peace and safety for the Downwood Forest. Tail Feathers' innovative game system will provide hours of fun and excitement in the world of Mice and Mystics.

The players attempt to buy and then develop properties in different German cities. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes. The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build 1 hotel on each of these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the property and if there is an hotel on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card (Lotterie or "?") and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income or winnings, or go to jail. The players may stay on the "Weekend" space and rest, if they pay 1000,- per turn.

Solve the maximum number of crimes to become an expert in criminal investigation.
The goal is to solve a series of crimes and do it before the opposing team. A player reads the case and the rest will be detectives. Any player of the team makes a question to the master, he responds with YES or NOT, then any player of the other team makes another question. When a team has enought clues, try to resolve the case. If the explanation is correct, the team wins the game if not, the other team ask again. The team that resolved the crime before the other, wins the game.

Publisher's ad copy: "'Into the Pocket! is a wargame about the German attempt to rescue the desperate forces trapped in the Stalingrad Pocket. It appears in the third issue of Yaah! magazine:

It's  an honest-to-gosh, hex-and-counter, odds-and-CRT, column-shiftin', panzer-pushin' Eastern Front WWII wargame. Can three desperate Panzer divisions punch a hole in the Stalingrad Pocket big enough to save the encircled 6th Army? Or will they be overwhelmed by a seemingly endless supply of Soviet forces? It's good ol' fashioned historical wargaming at its finest, harkening back to the era when gamers were gamers, and the fate of the world hinged on a +2DRM with 3:1 odds!

It's a small footprint game, ideal for newbies, played with 88 counters and a gorgeous 12x18.5 inch map illustrated by rising star Ania Ziolkowska. A background article about German military tradition by Sean Chick rounds out the package."

From the publisher's website:
                                                                 

     THE BOARD GAME FOR ONE PERSON ONLY....ANYONE, ANYWHERE, ANYTIME.
     EVERY GAME AS EASY OR AS DIFFICULT AS YOU CHOOSE TO MAKE IT.
     107 LETTERS...CAN YOU USE EVERY ONE OF THEM ?
     EVERY GAME YOU PLAY.........ITLMAKEUTHINK.


OBJECT OF THE GAME 
                                                                    Successfully place all 107 letters on the board, by forming words both horizontally and vertically.  
                                                                     With 7 different levels of play to choose from, the smaller that you make your playing area, the more difficult your game then becomes.

Italy needs a champion!
Are you a skilled and focused pizza maker …?

Look at the ingredients and sort your cards out quickly.  You must prepare your customers' orders as quickly as possible.  Put 4 cards together and make a pizza with cheese, peppers, mushrooms and olives!

As the game progresses the orders will get more and more complicated and the challenge will be harder and harder to meet!

A game requiring alertness and observation for novice pizza makers and head chefs.

The players have to go around the game track three times with their trucks, while picking up and delivering cargo. Movement is determined by a die. At the end of the game, the players get points awarded for the cargo on their truck (more if it is in their own Color) and for the order of their arrival at the finish.

Gladiator: Quest for the Rudis is a board & card game designed for 1 to 6 players (solo-play rules are included). Moment to moment the contest requires tactical decisions of movement, positioning and the selection of your attack and defense, while important strategic options always loom, such as how much of your stamina to expend as you risk becoming fatigued.

The gladiatorial contests in the game offer a very detailed simulation of many aspects of the historical battles, but gameplay itself is not slow or tedious as a result. That is, despite an enormous historical fidelity, Gladiator: Quest for the Rudis plays quickly and easily like the best modern board games. This is due in large part to the innovative card-based game play. There are no dice, and for the multi-player game, no books full of tables to consult, no other resource whatsoever to consult except for the cards themselves.

The Battlefield 2-player card game from NewVenture Games has been popular for some time. The American Civil War edition commemorates the 150th anniversary of that great conflict, the cards being completely redesigned to depict army units, officers, and civilians from the 1860s. One player assumes the role of the Union, the other plays Confederate units, meeting on the field of battle. In skirmish after skirmish, players deploy their forces card after card, fighting gallantly for their nation's survival.

Each of the two decks contain 72 cards, from the volunteer infantry with aged muskets, to the advanced firepower of artillery and cavalry. Famous generals take to the field, supported by the Corps of Engineers, civilian support groups, and even the President may make an appearance. Hope to avoid disease and inclement weather, and hope for a prisoner exchange or timely reinforcements.

From the front cover and opening chapter:

Rules for a tabletop game of jungle exploration and monster hunting for kids age 7 and older.

Includes Bonus Game Cowboys vs. Dinos

The crazy wild man stumbled out of the jungle into the village on the Nile. He babbled about lost treasures, a remote valley, and a giant ape. Nobody believed him at first, but then, as he gasped his last breath, his hand fell to his side and a golden medallion clattered to the ground. Rumors quickly spread to all parts of Africa: somewhere in the deepest, darkest jungle is a valley filled with treasure...and one giant ape guarding it all.

Into the Jungle
Valley of the Ape offers some simple rules for kids to play a tabletop game of exploration and monster hunting. Adults might offer some advice and help collecting all the terrain and pieces; they could also provide guidance, answer questions, or referee disputes at the game table during play.

User description
Valley Of The Ape is a light, kid friendly wargame. Players take turns moving then attacking. Resolution is done with d6. The PDF includes rule summary sheets and marker cards that can be cutout and use during play.

Many Parsecs of Space (working title but yes - pun intended!) is an upcoming space 4X game that reimplements Martin Wallace's innovative deck building mechanic from A Few Acres of Snow. Anyone familiar with AFAoS or Mythotopia will be playing MPoS in minutes, though it's far from a simple reskinning. MPoS takes the core mechanic in an entirely new direction by introducing exploration and trade in a multi-player science fiction setting. Location (world) cards are variable and hidden at setup and revealed only when explored. This is not only thematic, but creates infinite replayability and solves the dominant strategy issues (ex. Halifax's Hammer) that can plague low luck games with a static setup. Trading with your neighbor is essential because nearby star systems may lack the resources you need to expand your empire.

GAME FEATURES:

     Unique sentient races for asymmetrical play.
     Secretly customize your race beforehand so other players won't know what they're up against until first contact!
     Choose a government and economy that allows you to discard, reserve, and remove cards according to your playing style. 
     A world suitable for your race to colonize may not be for your neighbor. One race's garbage is another race's treasure!
     Technology cards function like empire cards from AFAoS but with the added wrinkle of a tech tree.
     Steal resources and technology from your neighbor or trade partner with piracy and espionage.
     5 scarce resources (energy, metals, military, organics, and science) must be acquired so trading is a MUST to efficiently grow your empire.
     Discover ancient artifacts on dead planets and worm holes that connect distant star systems.
     Terraform tide locked worlds to make them suitable for colonization.
     Invade an outpost or colony to make it your own or NUKE it so nobody can colonize it!

Drapacze Chmur ("Skyscrapers") is a fast game suitable for children. Players, simultaneously, search through a pile of square building elements. Whoever builds higher skyscraper is the winner. 
The only rule is, that each next element needs to have less windows than the previous.

There is also an game mode, where the specific color of an element gives a player 1 additional point.

In JurassAttack!, two players face off in an epic face-to-face dinosaur battle!

In the game, each player chooses a dinosaur or pack of dinosaurs of the same type from their hand, then they reveal them simultaneously to compare Ferocity values. The player with the highest total Ferocity wins the round, taking their rival's dinosaurs into their score pile. Different types of dinosaurs are worth varying amounts of victory points, so it's important to plan well and make sure not to give away too many points in the event of a knockout!

These fierce, prehistoric beasts each have their own special effects as well. Some hunt alone while others may pack with dinos of different types. And sometimes, with a well-placed bluff, players may even be able to sneak some of their precious eggs into their own score pile to protect the future generation.

Flying saucers game has an interesting introductory story. Somewhere in space four civilizations fight for resources.

Figurines represent different categories of flying saucers, which differ in speed, size and power. Flying saucers destroy enemy saucers by stopping next to it. Flying saucer with more power, or joined multiple saucers can destroy enemy flying saucer. The goal of the game is to destroy the main enemy flying saucer.

The game can be played with dice or without it.

The sky breaks blue and bright over a mouth-watering field of obstacles. You’ve adopted, loved, and trained your team of Agility Dogs to share in the joys of a day just like this. Their exuberance is catching as they prepare to breathtakingly weave the poles, sail over hurdles, blast through tunnels, round corners at top speed with fur a-tussle, and harness lightning while waiting for your cue on the trust-testing pause box. Your Husky's glacier blue eyes are clear and focused, your Golden Retriever mirrors the sun with radiant energy, and the feisty little Jack Russell pup is ready to run with the big dogs. Test your wit and instincts in this two-player game of vision and versatility!

Agility applies a unique mechanic in which cards that supply resources also select actions. On your turn, you play a Training Card that provides one of two types of resources in varying quantities while also granting an action building off of what your opponent just played. This encourages clever planning and timing. Training you need may be at odds with the action you’d like, so weighing your options will be crucial. Resources may be used to adopt dogs or to clear obstacles on the three courses you've drafted from the six available each game. Courses can only be claimed once a dog is adopted, so there is a race within a race to snatch up Wonderdogs or Underdogs well suited to the available courses. Then it’s nip and tuck as the canine competitors bound over, under, and through to the finish lines!

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the theme park Clearwater Marine Aquarium
This is an entertaining party game like Taboo where you have to describe a word to your teammates without using specific words as fast as you can!

Creepy Treat Combat is a collectable trading trading card game based on the cards found in the video game Costume Quest by Double Fine

The game uses a simple push your luck mechanic.  Each card has a number, and may have text describing a special effect.  Players take turns drawing cards or holding, attempting to reach the highest total without going over 13.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rotterdam, the largest port of Europe.

Objective: gain as many victory points as possible; use the bible as a guide for all vital questions.

Biblisches Frage- & Antwort-Spiel is a trivia game. Players ask each other questions extracted from better-known Bible stories.
For each correct answer the player gains a card/victory point.
The game includes 2x 110 cards with 110 questions and answers each.

Later edition (after WW2) are containing modifications, such as difficulty levels (with more victory points for more difficult questions).

All The cheese of 80's B-movies converges into one alien zombie infested town. And you must survive!

SO what makes this so 'Deluxe'?

Well its because it also includes the first expansion IT'S A TRAP!!! before its released separately. 40 more cards plus the New Trapping Dynamic AND ALIENS!

It’s time for a survival game that doesn't take it self so seriously! You are a mercenary dropped into the overrun town of Wellsville. Your only ticket out is by retrieving survivors, searching for the antidote and murdering the undead (or your fellow players).

Travel through the overrun town, gain access to buildings by drawing door cards, and collect Loot cards to find rewards. Use looted weapons to increase your attack rolls, defend against zombies, Alien Bio-weapons, Idiot Strippers and your fellow players.

Beware the Event cards as they change the dynamics of the whole board, and either help or screw everyone. Amass 10 survivor points by any means necessary and get to the choppa to win.

Gameplay involves rolling dice for movement and battle, and card pulls for reward, door opening and mass events. So much variety you'll never get bored.


    Easy battle mechanics that allow you to collect zombies, or pick off other players,



    Play as a zombie when you die and wipe out the other players to win alternately.

GobbleStones is a tile-laying game in which players are hungry little goblins who love to eat stones. During play, you gobble up the most valuable stones across the board, and in the end the fattest goblin wins. It's CRUNCH time!!!

In more detail, players set up the game board by laying nine game boards in a 3x3 square; each game board features 25 spaces on it in a 5x5 array, and each space has both a color (one of five) and a number (one of six). Thus, you'll have a game board that measures 15 spaces on each side.

Players start with several 1x1 tiles, with each tile being one of the five colors. On a turn, you take exactly five actions, first playing 0-5 tiles, then drawing 5-0 tiles, e.g., playing three tiles, then drawing two. You play tiles onto the game board akin to playing words in Scrabble, with you covering the appropriate colors with your tiles as a single word and scoring the numbers that you cover. One tile-laying restriction: You can't place tiles so that a 2x2 area of the game board is covered.

Revised July 2024

Torpedo Junction: Beneath the Southern Cross, Part I is the first installment of simulations of the Guadalcanal Campaign and other naval/air battles in 1942. Torpedo Junction includes the Battle of the Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz, and several other scenarios occuring in the eastern portion of the Solomons -- around the area known as "Torpedo Junction".

I've been calling BTSC "Flat Top on steroids".  The scale is 16.8 nautical miles per hex; the map covers from Shortland Island to Esperitu Santo, and Off Board Movement Mat allow players to move between the map and Rabaul, Truk, Noumea, Fiji, and Townsville.

The game revolves around three goals:  "Fuel 'em, Find 'em, Strike 'em".  You will need to track fuel status of your task forces, and might have to find an oiler at an inconvenient moment.  Your carriers and long-range scout planes (PBYs, H6Ks, and H8Ks) search for the other side, and when you find them, launch strikes to take out the enemy carriers.

The game includes 1.3" x .65" counters for every warship and most auxiliaries. Plane counters are .625" square, and most game markers are either that size or 1/2" square.

Each turn is one hour of time. Each hex is 16.8 nautical miles; ground units are mainly regiments and each step is roughly a company.  Plane types are rated for movement and endurance, and all planes can add extra bursts of speed--at the risk of losing endurance.  Planes also have various combat modifiers.

The game includes numerous player aid cards as well as a 16-page Charts & Tables booklet.

The files you see here are near-final production graphics. Bruce Yearian is the Graphic Designer.

Planet Zongo' is based on the proliferation of small arms. This game is about an epidemic, but instead of being threatened by diseases or zombies, the players must escape their own weapons. In this game, players may even want to give weapons to  their opponents in order to get rid of them.  
 Like in other games, players need armies to protect themselves or attack their opponents. They also have populations to sustain their armies. But the problem is: 
 1. Weapons never leave the game. When an army is killed, its weapons stay on the board. Those weapons are given to another population (even belonging to another player). That population thus becomes an army. 
2. But armies need populations. When an army is not sustained by a population, it starves and is removed from the game. However, as explained in rule 1, its weapons stay on the board and will be given to another population. 
 As more and more weapons are added in the course of the game, this mechanic threatens the players with a snowball effect: The more armies get destroyed, the more populations become armies by receiving weapons.The  more populations become armies, the less armies can be sustained… And so it gets only worse: as those unsustained armies are eliminated, the remaining populations receive even more weapons ...  
 The winner will be the player that best survives this process.

This is a card game where up to six players take turns to evolve fish from the Cambrian era up to the Carboniferous era. The title comes from a geologists mnemonic for the Earth's geological eras. 
Players have a hand of cards which depict many aspects of evolution including species of fish; events such as major catastrophes and changes to the plankton species; breeding and feeding; genetic mutations and advantages. Each game lasts 6 rounds and players try to evolve the most advanced fish they can before inevitable extinctions reduce their populations to dust.

The Goddess Izanami has fallen, allying the spirits of Yomi with the demons of Jigoku to invade the mortal realm through Yomi's Gate! Will you enlist with the shogunate to protect the celestial order? Or will you join Izanami and seek to shatter it?

Yomi's Gate is a tactical game of map control and unit management. Lead samurai and oni units into battle and use each of their special abilities to conquer a map that's different every time you play.

Capture the enemy stronghold, defeat their leaders, or eliminate their army to win!

Dead Sails is a 3-4 player tabletop game where you use coins to attack ships and out-plunder your pirate friends. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins. Plays in 30-60 minutes.

Played with laser-cut coins, Dead Sails is a bidding game about choosing your battles wisely and outwitting your friends. Use attack coins to plunder ships from the Merchant Fleet and the Royal Navy, treasure coins to bid on weapons from the Black Market and to hire mercenaries, and special coins like the Spyglass to gather intelligence on what your opponents are plotting.

This is the First in the Pages of War Series of Card Games: M.O.D.E (Men, Orcs, Dragkins, Elves)

Pages of War: M.O.D.E is a richly strategic game with simple mechanics and a unique flavour.

You take on the role of a bard of 1 of the 4 races in the western lands of the continent of Murghingale: MEN of the Blue Mountain, ORCS of the Black Hills, DRAGKINS of the Cloudy Peaks, and ELVES of the Verdant-Wood.

As a bard of one of these races your goal is to tell the greatest tale of its glory and strength by reciting the rhymes and songs of history.

BASICS:
Each player gets a deck (Historia) of 30 cards containing 22 heroes of 3 of the 5 suits (Axe, Bow, Sword, Lance, and Winged), 3 Jacks (generals of their 3 suits), 3 Aces (special tactics) and 2 monarchs (King and Queen).

The Goal is to create chapters (groups of heroes) that are strong enough to find the other players' Kings and Queens and destroy them - defeating other players' chapters and collecting their cards as spoils of war as you battle to achieve victory.

Once a player's King and Queen are destroyed they are eliminated from the battle to win but can turn the tide of combat with their remaining cards by adding their heroes to the chapters of other players.

From the box:

The hilarious and insightful game where... "Everyone has an opinion and every opinion counts!" - if you match!!!

Gameplay:
The object of Elephonkey is for teams of 2+ players to score points by matching their opinions with those of their teammates by listing and ranking the top 5 answers in each opinion poll.  During each round, each team draws an opinion poll card and a category on the card is chosen by rolling the provided dice (one die decides the category while the other determines the point values).  When the timer begins, each player begins listing their opinions (e.g. Top 5 Bruce Willis movies) on one of the provided pads. After 90 seconds, players compare their answers with their teammates and are awarded points for direct and indirect answers, unless otherwise stated. The game ends once one team reaches the pre-determined number of points.

An alternate take on the Connect 4 style of gameplay, 5-Across is a vertical game played with checkers.  The board is placed on the stand to hold it vertically and players drop checkers into one of the 7 slots until one player succeeds in getting 5 in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally.

Pig Out, Pete! is an electronic game in which Pete moves around and makes funny sounds as he throws up plastic food. Every 15 seconds, Pete will throw up a piece of food and players must dig through a tray of slime/gunk (much like Gak) for a plastic food piece of the same color. Once a player finds the correct piece, they set it aside along with the matching piece that Pete threw up. After Pete has fully purged himself and all of the pieces have been collected, the player with the most wins.

This is a deduction through conversation game. Exercise your vivid imagination and infer the thing that comes into your opponent’s mind by using the sense of touch. 
Due to the nature of the game, the visually impaired people can enjoy and play, too!

//story

In ancient times, when the mammoths and dinosaurs walked the land, or perhaps even before that, there was a civilization called “Dattakamo”. Its people excelled at making things out of clay, of which they made many: from what they found at the bottom of the ocean, to what they saw in the beyond the galaxy; from flowers and animals around them, to things from the imaginary future.  They treasured what they had made, and lived happily. One day, however, a volcano suddenly erupted and the civilization perished.

Time flew by, and now in the present, the works of the “Dattakamo” people have been excavated and brought into the Academy. What are they? Some of the artifacts are broken; others, with strange and bizarre shapes. All of them were treasures of the “Dattakamo” people.

In the Academy, a renowned professor and his students sit around these artifacts. The professor wonders what the pieces are, while his students discuss his ideas earnestly.

// Game Progress

The purpose of this game is that the students guess right what the professor imagines. The students ask the professor three questions, one at a time, during their turns. This is called the “discussion”, and a discussion has 3 rounds.  The professor has to answer correctly these questions. During this phase, students can freely touch the piece as many times as they want.
If a student manages to make a correct guess, he gets the piece from the professor.
When all the players have finished playing the role of the professor, the game ends and the player who acquires the most artifacts is the greatest professor ? and wins!
